cab.content:
(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)
SECRET.
G.T. 5065.
IMPERIAL WAR CABINET.
DISCUSSION ON PEACE TERMS.
Note by the Secretary with reference to Imperial War Cabinet 23, Minute 8.
War Cabinet on terms of peace to commence next Tuesday are the following:-
Report of the Committee of the Imperial War Cabinet on Territorial Desiderata, dated April 28, 1917 (P-16): Report of the Committee of the Imperial War Cabinet on Non-Territorial Desiderata, dated April 24, 1917, (P-15):
The volume of the Minutes of the discussions of the Imperial War Cabinet 1917. -- The discussion on peace terms took place in the course of the 12th and 13th Meetings.
All the above papers have been circulated to the representatives of the Dominions on the Imperial War Cabinet.
I am checking how far British Members have these papers and will complete the files where necessary.
(Sgd.) M.P.A. HANKEY.
Secretary,
Imperial War Cabinet.
2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.,
July 9th, 1918.
